text: {{Infobox writer | name = Lauren Weisberger | image = Lauren Weisberger.jpg | image_size = | caption = Weisberger in 2013 | pseudonym = | birth_date = | birth_place = Scranton, Pennsylvania, U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | alma_mater = Cornell University | occupation = | period = 2003â€“present | genre = Fiction | subject = | movement = | notableworks = The Devil Wears Prada | spouse = |children = 2 | website = }} Lauren Weisberger (born March 28, 1977) is an American novelist. She was the author of the 2003 bestseller The Devil Wears Prada, which is based on her experience as an assistant to Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour. ==References== Category:1977 births Category:Living people Category:American novelists Category:Writers from Pennsylvania Category:People from Scranton, Pennsylvania
title: Lauren Weisberger
